text: early in November dozens of Saudi
Arabia's richest men including members
of the royal family was swept up and
detained in Riyadh's ritz-carlton hotel
it's been called an anti-corruption
drive but opposition sources have
claimed inmates were being tortured and
required to sign over their fortunes in
order to be released those facing
interrogation included Prince Walid bin
Talal who's estimated eighteen billion
dollar fortune with stakes in Euro
Disney and high-profile Western tech
companies makes him Saudi Arabia's
richest businessman but his wealth and
family connections have also made him a
rival to Mohammed bin Salman Crown
Prince and architect of the
anti-corruption drive on Monday the arab
digest website reported that
canadian-based businessman alan bender
seen here to the right of Walid bin
Talal had been flown to the kingdom as
it built a case against Prince Walid mr.
bender was taken to a site near the
hotel BBC Newsnight managed to locate
mr. bender in Toronto he was able to
confirm his trip to Riyadh in December
and that he'd spoken via videoconference
while there with the detained Prince he
was brought in through the
teleconference and was sat down I we
were looking at each other face to face
did he look as if he was in some way
being ill-treated or was he just shocked
to see you how would you describe his
appearance I would say he looked he
didn't look comfortable he wasn't he was
unshaven he didn't look in his best
condition at all he looked tired a lot
of twitching during the conversation
well while I was reading the script out
to him the Saudi authorities had
prepared a script of allegations for mr.
bender to read out to willie'd bin Talal
via video teleconference linked I would
say my presence was to be used as
probably evidence
of details that they needed to confront
him because I'm probably the only person
who was involved in personal and direct
negotiations with him related to a very
personal matter those very personal
matters related to Willie's separation
from a former long-term partner who mr.
bender represented in settlement
negotiations the Saudi authorities it
seems want to use this to pressure will
lead to sign over his foreign wealth
these two know each other very well and
the Saudis flew in Alan bender and other
old business adversaries of Walid to try
and put pressure on him to try and crack
him and make him do what Mohammed bin
Salman wants which is hand over all his
foreign assets and make videotaped
confessions admitting to all his guilt
and swearing allegiance the Saudis have
announced that the ritz-carlton will
soon revert to its normal role as a
hotel but there's evidence that some key
detainees including Prince Walid had
been transferred to detention elsewhere
even in December it looked more like I
would say a detention room or something
related to a jail cell even the sounds
of doors sliding back and forth
I didn't look or sound like he was at
the rest Carlton Alan benders account is
a singular one and the Saudi authorities
have not yet responded to our request
for comment but it gives a good idea of
the lengths the kingdom's rulers are
willing to go to humble a prince who was
their most successful businessman mark
urban BBC news
